title: (x) "Eat, Drink, Sleep, Shop, See" tech sans on Silverjet website - DIN 1451 Mittelschrift {Patricia}
content:
What is the font used in the Eat Drink Sleep Shop See headers?

Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Eat-Drink-Sleep-etc.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014145456/http:/typophile.com/files/Eat-Drink-Sleep-etc.jpg) | 102.08 KB |

 [‹ Fashion Diverse Typo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014145456/http:/typophile.com/node/30741 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Peugeot 205 t16 font - Traffic {Lex} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014145456/http:/typophile.com/node/33357 "Go to next forum topic")
author: drmns

comments.content:
Din.

Looks most like 1451 to me but it could be FF Medium.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/din-1451/](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014145456/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/din-1451/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/din-1451/")

Thanks so much!

If it’s Din, would anyone know of a “Din-like” font with OSF?

Strange, according to their brand guidelines (sent to me on Friday, for a new project) it’s **supposed** to be Dalton Maag’s [Foco](http://web.archive.org/web/20081014145456/http:/www.daltonmaag.com/browse/fonts/dama/foco).

Richard

\> _If it’s Din, would anyone know of a “Din-like” font with OSF?_

FF DIN has OsF.
They’re using Foco in their print ads, but it’s nowhere to be found on their website. Odd.
